Package Pong

Class Paddle

java.lang.Object
Pong.Paddle
public class Paddle
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Paddle​(int x, int y, int PaddleWidth, int PaddleHeight, java.lang.String paddleLeftOrRight, int distance)
    Multi-argument constructor for Paddle Class that takes 6 arguments.
    Paddle​(java.lang.String PaddleLeftOrRight)
    Single argument constructor nested with if statements to distinguish between the left and right paddles and sets the X and Y coordinates of both.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getDistance()
    Method to get the distance for the paddle to move in either the upwards or downwards direction
    int getPaddleHeight()
    Method to get the height of the paddle

    Method to distinguish between the left and right paddle
    int getPaddleWidth()
    Method to get the width of the paddle
    int getX()
    Method to get the y coordinate of the paddle
    int getY()
    Method to get the y coordinate of the paddle
    void movePaddle​(boolean checkDirection)
    Method that gets passed up a boolean value from the PongGame driver and performs calculations to allow the Left and Right paddles to either move up or down.
    void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
    Render method that uses the graphics class as an argument for use of .setColor() which sets the color of the paddle, in this case red and the .fillRect() that takes 4 parameters, to define the area of the paddle.
    void setDistance​(int distance)
    Method to set the distance for the paddle to move in either the upwards or downwards direction
    void setPaddleHeight​(int paddleHeight)
    Method to set the height of the paddle

    Method to set the width of the paddle

    Method to set the value of the x coordinate of the paddle

    Method to set the value of the y coordinate of the paddle

  • Constructor Details

    • Paddle

      public Paddle​(int x, int y, int PaddleWidth, int PaddleHeight, java.lang.String paddleLeftOrRight, int distance)
      Multi-argument constructor for Paddle Class that takes 6 arguments. 6 Mutators called to initialise the 6 objects called via user input.
      Parameters:
      x - defines the x coordinate of the Paddle of type int
      y - defines the y coordinate of the Paddle of type int
      PaddleWidth - defines the width of the Paddle of type int
      PaddleHeight - defines the height of the Paddle of type int
      paddleLeftOrRight - variable to distinguish between the left and right paddle of type String.
      distance - defines the distance the paddle moves in a set direction (either up or down) upon a key pressed.

    • Paddle

      public Paddle​(java.lang.String PaddleLeftOrRight)
      Single argument constructor nested with if statements to distinguish between the left and right paddles and sets the X and Y coordinates of both.
      Parameters:
      PaddleLeftOrRight - distinguishes between left and right paddles

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Render method that uses the graphics class as an argument for use of .setColor() which sets the color of the paddle, in this case red and the .fillRect() that takes 4 parameters, to define the area of the paddle.
      Parameters:
      g - name of graphics object

    • movePaddle

      public void movePaddle​(boolean checkDirection)
      Method that gets passed up a boolean value from the PongGame driver and performs calculations to allow the Left and Right paddles to either move up or down.
      Parameters:
      checkDirection - either true or false

      public int getX()
      Method to get the y coordinate of the paddle

      an int value specifying the x coordinate of the paddle

      Method to set whether the paddle will be the left or the right
      Parameters:
      paddleLeftOrRight - indicates whether the left or right paddle is being referred to

    • getDistance

      public int getDistance()
      Method to get the distance for the paddle to move in either the upwards or downwards direction

      an int value specifying the distance to move

    • setDistance
